name: 2-fluorobiphenyl-4-boronic acid
Reason: The basic units for 2-fluorobiphenyl-4-boronic acid include biphenyl and the functional groups include a fluorine substituent and a boronic acid group. The basic biphenyl has a melting point around 70°C. Substituents generally increase the melting point due to the addition of intermolecular forces. The fluorine substituent contributes to a higher melting point through inductive effects and dipole-dipole interactions, which may add roughly 20-30°C to the base value. The boronic acid group also increases the melting point significantly through hydrogen bonding and the introduction of a polar boron-oxygen bond, potentially contributing an additional 150-170°C. Combining these effects, I predict an increase in the melting point.
